intro: Schoepfia arenaria, commonly known as the desert cholla, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its cylindrical, spiny stems that branch out near the base. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer, followed by dry, winged fruits that aid in seed dispersal. Its succulent leaves are reduced to small spines, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Schoepfia arenaria is well adapted to desert conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species.
